meanings.definition: In a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: She walked gawkily across the stage, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: He danced gawkily at the party, bumping into people around him.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled gawkily on the ice, trying to keep its balance.
meanings.sent4: The robot moved gawkily, as if it was learning to walk for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The toddler attempted to run gawkily, arms flailing in all directions.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of grace or coordination
meanings.sent1: The gawkily dressed man stood out in the crowd with his mismatched outfit.
meanings.sent2: Her gawkily movements on the dance floor drew attention to her lack of experience.
meanings.sent3: The gawkily decorated cake collapsed under the weight of too many toppings.
meanings.sent4: The tree swayed gawkily in the wind, its branches unable to support the heavy snow.
meanings.sent5: The old car moved gawkily down the road, rattling with each bump.
